name: 1.5 - What type of feature transformation was used?
1.7 - What type of feature selection was used?
1.9 - What type of dimension reduction was used?
1.10 - Provide dimension before and after any feature selection and/or dimension reduction
1.11 - Information on how the target values relate to the population. Specify how this is taken into account in the predictive model
1.14 - Assumptions made on the covariance structure
1.17 - For kernel-based methods (i.e. SVM) report type of kernel used, type and number of parameters needed to be estimated
1.20 - Parameter settings, those fixed and those estimated; specify how fixed parameter values were chosen
1.21 - How the convergence of the learning method is monitored
1.22 - Pipeline structure applied uniformly to all cases (e.g. that could be independently applied to a new case)
1.32 - Report receiver operating characteristic curves and area under the curve.
1.35 - For representational similarity analysis, report the Kendall Tau statistic for each candidate model considered.
1.36 - When possible use formal test to obtain P­value to assess whether evaluation metric is “significant” or consistent with noise.
1.37 - Procedure used to interpret the fit of the classifier, identifying the relative importance of the features (e.g. the weight vector in linear discriminant).
